Name: Elcer Duberli
description:
Elcer, age 33, has three children, ages 14, 12, and 10. At this time he is single, and his children are his force for continuing to strive for his goals.

He is considered to be a hard-working, honest, and enterprising man. For 10 years he has had a business of [raising and selling] cacao in the dried stage and in the pulp stage.

It is for this reason that his great challenge is to keep his crop free from pests in order to increase the quality and quantity of production and to always offer a good product to his customers [so that] they remain satisfied.

Additionally, his great dream is to modernize his cultivation.

In addition to this business, his other source of income is his contracted services as day laborer, which he does occasionally and which allows him to improve his economic income.

He will use the Kiva loan for the maintenance of his parcels [of land], such as pruning and cultivation of the cacao. With the extra earnings, he will improve his house.
